Heading: Abridged edition
Note: Content has been shortened: use for abridged, shortened, concise, condensed

Heading: Acting edition
Note: Version of a play or script intended for use of those directly involved in a production, usually including full stage directions in addition to the text of the script

Heading: Adapted edition
Note: Content has been adapted to serve a different purpose or audience, or from one medium to another: use for dramatization, novelization etc. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the adaptation

Heading: Alternate
Note: Do not use. This code is now DEPRECATED, but is retained in the list for reasons of backwards compatibility

Heading: Annotated edition
Note: Content is augmented by the addition of notes

Heading: Bilingual edition
Note: Both languages should be specified in the <Language> group. Use MLL for an edition in more than two languages

Heading: Bilingual ‘facing page’ edition
Note: Use only where the two languages are presented in parallel on facing pages, or in parallel columns of text on a single page (otherwise use BLL). Both languages should be specified in the <Language> group

Heading: Braille edition
Note: Braille edition

Heading: Combined volume
Note: An edition in which two or more works also published separately are combined in a single volume; AKA ‘omnibus’ edition

Heading: Critical edition
Note: Content includes critical commentary on the text

Heading: Coursepack
Note: Content was compiled for a specified educational course

Heading: Digital original
Note: A digital product that, at the time of publication, has or had no print counterpart and that is or was not expected to have a print counterpart for a reasonable time (recommended at least 30 days following publication)

Heading: Enhanced edition
Note: Use for e-publications that have been enhanced with additional text, speech, other audio, video, interactive or other content

Heading: Enlarged edition
Note: Content has been enlarged or expanded from that of a previous edition

Heading: Expurgated edition
Note: ‘Offensive’ content has been removed

Heading: Facsimile edition
Note: Exact reproduction of the content and format of a previous edition

Heading: Festschrift
Note: A collection of writings published in honor of a person, an institution or a society

Heading: High readability edition
Note: Edition optimised for high readability, typically featuring colored or tinted page backgrounds to reduce contrast, extra letter, word and line spacing to reduce crowding and isolate individual words, simplified page layouts and an open, sans serif font (or occasionally, an unusual font design) intended to aid readability. Sometimes labelled ‘dyslexia-friendly’. See also code SMP if the text itself is simplified, and codes LTE or ULP if the type size is significantly larger than normal. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Illustrated edition
Note: Content includes extensive illustrations which are not part of other editions

Heading: International edition
Note: A product aimed specifically at markets other than the country of original publication, usually titled as an ‘International edition’ and with specification and/or content changes

Heading: Large type / large print edition
Note: Large print edition, print sizes 14 to 19pt – see also ULP

Heading: Microprint edition
Note: A printed edition in a type size too small to be read without a magnifying glass

Heading: Media tie-in
Note: An edition published to coincide with the release of a film, TV program, or electronic game based on the same work. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the tie-in

Heading: Multilingual edition
Note: All languages should be specified in the ‘Language’ group. Use BLL for a bilingual edition

Heading: New edition
Note: Where no other information is given, or no other coded type or edition numbering is applicable

Heading: Edition with numbered copies
Note: A limited edition in which each copy is individually numbered, and the actual number of copies is strictly limited. Use <EditionStatement> to give details of the number of copies printed

Heading: Prebound edition
Note: In the US, a book that was previously bound, normally as a paperback, and has been rebound with a library-quality hardcover binding by a supplier other than the original publisher. See also the <Publisher> and <RelatedProduct> composites for other aspects of the treatment of prebound editions in ONIX

Heading: Revised edition
Note: Content has been revised from that of a previous edition (often used when there has been no corresponding increment in the edition number, or no edition numbering is available)

Heading: School edition
Note: An edition intended specifically for use in schools

Heading: Signed edition
Note: Individually autographed by the author(s)

Heading: Simplified language edition
Note: An edition that uses simplified language (Finnish ‘Selkokirja’)

Heading: Special edition
Note: Use for anniversary, collectors’, de luxe, gift, limited (but prefer codes NUM or UNN as appropriate), autographed (but prefer code SIG as appropriate) edition. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the special edition

Heading: Student edition
Note: Where a text is available in both student and teacher’s editions

Heading: Teacher’s edition
Note: Where a text is available in both student and teacher’s editions; use also for instructor’s or leader’s editions, and for editions intended exclusively for educators where no specific student edition is available

Heading: Unabridged edition
Note: Where a title has also been published in an abridged edition; also for audiobooks, regardless of whether an abridged audio version also exists

Heading: Ultra large print edition
Note: For print sizes 20pt and above, and with typefaces designed for the visually impaired – see also LTE

Heading: Edition with unnumbered copies
Note: A limited edition in which each copy is not individually numbered – but where the actual number of copies is strictly limited. Use <EditionStatement> to give details of the number of copies printed

Heading: Unexpurgated edition
Note: Content previously considered ‘offensive’ has been restored

Heading: Variorum edition
Note: Content includes notes by various commentators, and/or includes and compares several variant texts of the same work
